sentences.english: No one can stop the flight of the conceptual architects’ thought.
sentences.chinese: 谁也不能阻遏概念建筑师的思想天马行空。

sentences.english: Media test drive has always been unconstrained woolgather.
sentences.chinese: 媒体试驾向来是天马行空，独往独来。

sentences.english: What was once wild fantasy had become reality.
sentences.chinese: 这个一度天马行空的幻想已然成为事实。

sentences.english: This is my unconstrained woolgather, some are true, some are false.
sentences.chinese: 天马行空的胡思乱想，有真有假。

sentences.english: just being creative enough in my imagination.
sentences.chinese: 我的想象力还不够天马行空。

silly talk or "mo lei tau" (Cantonese), genre of humor emerging from Hong Kong late in the 20th century
imaginative/to have one's mind buzzing with ideas
to blow people's minds with highly imaginative, bizarre ideas
to imagine the wildest thing/to indulge in fantasy
not follow the beaten track/have an original style
conception/imagination
free and unconstrained (idiom); unfettered/unbuttoned/without care or worries
freak/weird

not stick to one pattern
